column4: hi, I can't set virtual in xorg.conf. I try to use an extra monitor but when I run xrandr it complains virtual size is too small
some idea? Is possible that last ubuntu version ignores /etc/X11/xorg.conf? Maybe another place to put virtual screen size?
I'm using fglrx if that helps....
You put virtual size in xorg.conf but check /var/log/Xorg.0.log for messages that it had an error
